page.title: 06INTERVIEW WITH RETIRED MAN.
page.content: In interviews which the children carried out,a number of people who had lived in West Kirby for a long time were asked about changes they had seen in the area and how they felt about the differences. One man who had lived in West Kirby for over fifty years felt that there had been a great deal of change.Many of the open spaces have been built upon and the new housing has tended to attract people who work elsewhere with a decline in the community spirit that was there when the population was much smaller. Other changes had been the closure of the railway and the outdoor swimming pool and the building of the Concourse so that leisure facilities are much more readily available than they were when he was a child when he had to find things to interest him.
